info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 6:52PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A Band of Snow Showers Will Continue Southeastward... At 6:45 PM, Doppler Radar and satellite imagery were tracking a band of snow showers moving southeastward across Southwest Montana. Visibility associated with this could fall as low as a half mile or less. Additionally, gusty winds will contribute to difficult travel conditions. Sudden reduction to visibility will be likely around the band of snow. If possible, delay travel to allow for the band of snow to pass southeastward.
